Interface GraphicalObject

All Known Implementing Classes:
ExampleKeyListener, ExampleMouseListener
public interface GraphicalObject
/** Interface to be implemented by any objects that are to display sprites
Includes default loading and rendering scripts, which can be overwritten for complex cases
(if there is more than one instance of a given complex case, form it into its own interface extending this)

Required class variables
static BufferedImage sprite;

 static String url = "path/to/image.png";


In the constructor
sprite = this.loadImage(this.url);


In the render method
this.drawSprite(g, sprite, (int)this.x, (int)this.y);

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default void drawSprite​(java.awt.Graphics g, java.awt.image.BufferedImage sprite, int x, int y)
    Renders a sprite
    default java.awt.image.BufferedImage loadImage​(java.lang.String url)
    Loads a sprite from a file, throwing an exception if an error occurs.
    This should be called in the constructor of any object that needs to load a sprite

  • Method Details

    • loadImage

      default java.awt.image.BufferedImage loadImage​(java.lang.String url)
      Loads a sprite from a file, throwing an exception if an error occurs.
      This should be called in the constructor of any object that needs to load a sprite
      Parameters:
      url - The relative url to the sprite image
      Returns:
      A BufferedImage object of the loaded sprite, or null if there was an error

    • drawSprite

      default void drawSprite​(java.awt.Graphics g, java.awt.image.BufferedImage sprite, int x, int y)
      Renders a sprite
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object onto which the sprite will be rendered
      sprite - The BufferedImage to be rendered
      x - The x coordinate at which the image will be rendered
      y - The y coordinate at which the image will be rendered
